newsitem.title: TAIWAN: China Development limit up in bonus, rights issue.
newsitem.headline: China Development limit up in bonus, rights issue.

text.p: China Development Corp surged in late Wednesday trade after saying it plans to issue a T$3 per share bonus and 421 million shares in rights issue on July 23, brokers said.
The rights issue of 421 million shares would have an underwriting price of T$71 per share, said China Development, one of Taiwan's leading venture capital and investment firms.
With 35 minutes left, at 0325 GMT, China Development was up T$9.5, or the daily seven percent limit, to T$155.

Brokers said China Development, which has applied to the finance ministry for permission to convert into an industrial bank, has potential to rise further because of its active investment in high-technology industry.
"With its active investment in many of Taiwan's best high-technology firms, China Development has the potential to generate huge profits," said indepedent analyst Michael Hung.
"Its rise has just started, and it wouldn't surprise me if China Development surges to T$200," Hung said.
